organic_results.title: The multilevel effects of background on science achievement: A cross-national comparison
organic_results.snippet: It is argued that the effects of family background on science achievement are the result of different processes between schools and within schools; therefore, an examination of the multilevel effects of background is warranted. Between schools, variation in the effects of family background reflects social policies that govern the relationship of community characteristics to school resources and activities. Within schools, the effects of family background result from the structure of interpersonal allocations of rewards within an …

publication_info.summary: L Burstein, KB Fischer, MD Miller - Sociology of Education, 1980 - JSTOR
